name: Salted Chocolate Chunk Cookies
description: Crisp-edged, soft within, finished with a faint crunch of sea salt, and absolutely puddled with chocolate.

recipe_ingredient.note: 1/2 cup (4 ounces or 113 grams) unsalted butter, at room temperature
recipe_ingredient.display: 1/2 cup (4 ounces or 113 grams) unsalted butter, at room temperature

recipe_ingredient.note: 3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons (165 grams) packed light or dark brown sugar
recipe_ingredient.display: 3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons (165 grams) packed light or dark brown sugar

recipe_ingredient.note: Heaped 1/4 teaspoon (or, technically, 1/4 + 1/8 teaspoon) fine sea or table salt
recipe_ingredient.display: Heaped 1/4 teaspoon (or, technically, 1/4 + 1/8 teaspoon) fine sea or table salt

recipe_ingredient.note: 1/2 pound (225 grams) semi- or bittersweet chocolate, cut into roughly 1/2-inch chunks with a serrated knife
recipe_ingredient.display: 1/2 pound (225 grams) semi- or bittersweet chocolate, cut into roughly 1/2-inch chunks with a serrated knife

recipe_instructions.text: Heat oven to 360°F (180°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicon baking mat.

In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugars together with an electric mixer until very light and fluffy, about 5 minutes. Add egg and vanilla, beating until incorporated, and scraping down the bowl as needed. Beat in salt fine sea or table salt and baking soda until combined, then the flour on a low speed until just mixed. The dough will look crumbly at this point. With a spatula, fold/stir in the chocolate chunks.

Scoop cookies into 1 1/2 tablespoon (I used a #40 scoop) mounds, spacing them apart on the prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle each with a few flakes of sea salt. Bake for 11 to 12 minutes, until golden on the outside but still very gooey and soft inside. Out of the oven, let rest on baking sheet out of the for 5 minutes before transferring a cooling rack.
